vault.subtitle: Manage your credentials with industry-grade security

sync_prompt.description: Connect to cloud storage to access your passwords anywhere.

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Manage your security and synchronization preferences

cloud.connect_desc: Connect to {{provider}} to enable automatic cloud backup and sync.
cloud.connection_failed: Connection failed. Please check your network.

settings.clear_cache_desc: This will remove local logs and temporary data. Your vault data will NOT be deleted.

biometric_modal.title: Enable Biometric Unlock
biometric_modal.description: Enter your master password to securely store it in your device's keychain.

export.title: Export Vault
export.warning_desc: You are about to export your passwords in plain text. Anyone with this file will be able to see your credentials. Store it securely.

import.title: Import Vault
import.drag_drop: Drag & Drop CSV/JSON here or Click to Select
import.note_desc: Duplicate entries will be added as new items with a timestamp tag. No existing data will be overwritten.

security.title: Security Health
security.subtitle: Real-time analysis of your credential vault

status.title: Protection Status
status.robust: Your digital vault is robust. Maintain strong 2FA everywhere.
status.decent: Your security is decent, but some improvements are needed.
status.weak: Immediate action recommended for weak credentials.

alerts.title: Security Alerts
alerts.empty: No security issues found. Great job!
alerts.weak_description: This password is too short or lacks complexity.

generator.title: Generator
generator.info: Higher entropy makes passwords harder to crack via brute-force.
generator.subtitle: Create strong, secure passwords

step1.title: Secure Your Vault
step1.subtitle: Create a master key to encrypt your data locally.

step2.title: Quick Access
step2.subtitle: Speed up your login experience securely.

error.length: Master Key must be at least 8 characters.
error.weak: Password is too weak. Use a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols.

sync.credentials_imported: Cloud vault found. Please log in again with your original password.
sync.use_cloud_complete: Switched to cloud vault. Please log in again with your cloud password.
sync.use_local_complete: Cloud has been overwritten with local data.
sync.salt_updated: Cloud security settings updated. You must log in again.

error.missing_verifier: Cloud vault is missing password verification data. Please sync from the original device first to update cloud metadata.
error.missing_password: Cloud password is required for merge.
error.no_cloud_entries: No cloud entries found to merge.
error.password_required: Cloud password is required to verify access before switching.

conflict.title: Sync Conflict Detected
conflict.description: Your local vault uses a different encryption key than the cloud vault.
conflict.merge_desc: Combine both vaults. Requires your CLOUD password.
conflict.use_cloud_desc: Clear local data. Use CLOUD password permanently.
conflict.enter_cloud_password: Enter your CLOUD password to decrypt and merge entries:

about.title: About
about.description: A secure, offline-first, cross-platform password manager built for privacy and simplicity.
about.privacy_desc: Your data is encrypted with AES-256-GCM purely on your device. We do not collect any personal data or analytics.

privacy_view.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_view.intro: EtherVault ("we", "our", or "the App") is an open-source, privacy-first password manager designed to respect and protect your digital privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how EtherVault handles your data.
privacy_view.summary: In short: We do not collect, store, or sell your personal data. You own your data.

1.title: 1. Data Collection and Storage
1.local_desc: EtherVault operates on a "Local-First" basis. All your sensitive data (usernames, passwords, notes, tags) is stored securely on your local device (computer or mobile phone). This data is encrypted using military-grade AES-256 encryption.
1.server_desc: We do not operate a central server to store your vault data. We (the developers of EtherVault) have no access to your master password, your stored credentials, or your encryption keys. If you lose your Master Password, we cannot recover your data for you.

2.title: 2. Cloud Synchronization
2.desc: EtherVault offers an optional feature to synchronize your data across devices using your own personal cloud storage providers (currently Google Drive).
points: Encryption Before Sync: All data is encrypted locally on your device BEFORE being uploaded to the cloud.
User Control: Synchronization is optional and must be explicitly enabled and authenticated by you.
Third-Party Policies: Data stored on your cloud provider is subject to that provider's privacy policy and terms of service.

3.title: 3. Biometric Data
3.desc: EtherVault supports unlocking the application using biometric authentication (Fingerprint, TouchID, FaceID).
points: Local Processing: Biometric verification is handled entirely by your device's operating system.
No Access: EtherVault receives only a "pass/fail" confirmation from the OS. We do not access, collect, store, or transmit your actual fingerprint or facial data.

4.title: 4. Third-Party Requests
4.desc: To improve the user experience, EtherVault may automatically fetch icons (favicons) for the websites you store in your vault.
points: These requests may be sent directly to the target website or via a privacy-respecting favicon service.
These requests may technically expose your IP address to the content provider, similar to visiting the website in a browser.

5.title: 5. Device Permissions
lists: Network/Internet Access: Required for Cloud Synchronization and fetching website icons.
Biometric Hardware: Required to enable Fingerprint/FaceID/TouchID unlock.
Storage/File System: Required to store your encrypted vault files locally and for Import/Export functionality.

6.title: 6. Logs & Analytics
lists: Crash Reports: The App does not automatically send crash reports to us.
Local Logs: Usage logs are stored locally on your device for your own auditing and debugging purposes. These logs never leave your device unless you manually export and share them.

7.title: 7. Changes to This Policy
7.desc: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Since the App is open source and local-first, significant changes to data handling would typically require a software update.

8.title: 8. Contact Us
8.desc: If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, you can reach out via our <0>GitHub</0> repository or project page.

privacy_view.footer: EtherVault — Your Code, Your Data, Your Vault.
